intro: Cambessedesia hilariana var. linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
